conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph and calculate the area under the curve for the interval 10 to 15 seconds.
Identify the interval from 10 seconds to 15 seconds.
Velocity decreases linearly from 20 m/s to 0 m/s between 10 and 15 seconds.
The area under the curve from 10 to 15 seconds forms a right triangle.
Base of the triangle is 5 seconds (15 seconds - 10 seconds).
Height of the triangle is 20 m/s (20 m/s - 0 m/s).
Area of the triangle is calculated as 50 meters using the formula: Area = 1/2 * base * height.
Distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is 50 meters.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is less than 75 meters.
